name.text: 1.4.2.3 Mult and div of algebraic fractions - examples

questiontext.text:
Example

Simplify: \( \dfrac{\dfrac{2x}{y}}{\dfrac{3x}{2y}}\)

Solution

We can write the fraction as \(\dfrac{2x}{y} \div \dfrac{3x}{2y}.\)

Inverting the second fraction and multiplying we find:

\[\dfrac{2x}{y} \times \dfrac{2y}{3x} = \dfrac{4xy}{3xy} = \dfrac{4}{3}\]

Example

Simplify: \[ \dfrac{4x+2}{x^2+4x+3} \times \dfrac{x+3}{7x+5} \]

Solution

Factorising the numerator and denominator we find

\[\dfrac{4x+2}{x^2+4x+3} \times \dfrac{x+3}{7x+5} = \dfrac{2(2x+1)}{(x+1)(x+3)} \times \dfrac{x+3}{7x+5}\]

\[ = \dfrac{2(2x+1)(x+3)}{(x+1)(x+3)(7x+5)}\]

\[= \dfrac{2(2x+1)}{(x+1)(7x+5)}\]
